protocol.text: No subsequent light treatment (WL0) (R:FR = 6.48); WL + FR (R:FR=0.006) for 1h (FR1); WL + FR (R:FR=0.006) for 3h (FR3); WL + FR (R:FR=0.006) for 24h (FR24); 24h WL continuous, R:FR=6.48 (WL24).

Arabidopsis wild-type (WT) and pifq mutant (Leivar et al., 2008) seeds were plated on GM medium without sucrose at room temperature. During this procedure, the seeds were routinely exposed to white light (WL) for a total of 1.5 hours after imbibition. Seeds were then stratified for 5 days at 4�C in darkness, and then grown in WL (19 μmol/m2/s, R/FR ratio of 6.48) for 2 days at 21�C.

Total RNA was extracted from ~400 mg (fw) tissue using the method of Chang et al. (Chang S, Puryear J & Cairney J (1993) Plant Mol. Biol. Rep. 11, 113-116), followed by further purification using Qiagen RNeasy columns.
BioConductor software (RMA) to normalize and correct background on all the data.
